message.content:
cs.HC, cs.CY, cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.CC 

The paper discusses the design and implementation of an assistive technology that coordinates collective intelligence to help individuals regulate their emotions. This involves the use of crowdsourcing and human computation techniques, which are commonly studied in the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) and Cybernetics (cs.CY) sub-categories. The paper also discusses the use of natural language processing and sentiment analysis, which are common topics in Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) and Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). Finally, the paper discusses the use of crowdsourcing platforms like Amazon's Mechanical Turk, which is a topic commonly studied in the Computation and Society (cs.CC) sub-category.
